intro: Geissorhiza helmei, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Geissorhiza helmei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
